user_question: How can I capture the Milky Way with my DSLR camera?
final_answer: To capture the Milky Way with a DSLR camera, use a wide-angle lens, set the aperture to the widest setting (e.g., f/2.8), use a high ISO (e.g., 1600-3200), and set the shutter speed to 20-30 seconds. Ensure you are in a dark location away from light pollution.
